availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James W. Shackelford (Mercer County, Kentucky, stonemason and farmer)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, farmer and stonemason. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Robertson Shackelford in Mercer County, Kentucky, on September 7, 1850. Father of Ludwell C. Shackelford, Mary F. Shackelford, and Emily Shackelford. Farmer in Mercer County in 1850. Stonemason in Mercer County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 2, p. 355A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 2, p. 595.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #272.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mercer County Marriages, Film #000191860, p. 149.
